name: df-algind
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3
body: |- wceq(cai, cmpo(s0, s1, universe, cpw(cfv(cbs, cv(s0))), crab(s2, cpw(cfv(cbs, cv(s0))), wfun(ccnv(cmpt(s3, cfv(cbs, co(cv(s2), cmpl, co(cv(s0), cress, cv(s1)))), cfv(cfv(cfv(co(cv(s2), ces, cv(s0)), cv(s1)), cv(s3)), cres(cid, cv(s2)))))))))
bodyPretty: ‚ä¢ AlgInd =(s0 ‚àà ùïå, s1 ‚àà P((Base ` s0))‚Ü¶ { s2 ‚àà P((Base ` s0))| Fun(`'(s3 ‚àà(Base `(s2[mPoly](s0[|`s]s1)))‚Ü¶((((s2[evalSub]s0)` s1)` s3)`(= |` s2))))})
comment: Define the predicate "the set ` v ` is algebraically independent in the algebra ` w ` ". A collection of vectors is algebraically independent if no nontrivial polynomial with elements from the subset evaluates to zero. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 21-Mar-2015.)
